Class OrderController

java.lang.Object
com.example.controller.OrderController
public class OrderController extends Object
The OrderController class manages the user interface for viewing and managing orders. It handles interactions with orders, menu items, and total price display.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<Integer>
    cb_orderNum
    ComboBox for selecting the order number from the list of available orders.
    javafx.scene.control.ListView<MenuItem>
    lv_menuItems
    ListView for displaying menu items associated with the currently selected order.

  • Field Details

    • cb_orderNum

      public javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<Integer> cb_orderNum
      ComboBox for selecting the order number from the list of available orders.

    • lv_menuItems

      public javafx.scene.control.ListView<MenuItem> lv_menuItems
      ListView for displaying menu items associated with the currently selected order.

  • Constructor Details

    • OrderController

      public OrderController()

  • Method Details

    • addOrder

      public void addOrder(Order order)
      Adds a new order to the list of orders and updates the ComboBox for order selection. Automatically selects the newly added order in the ComboBox.
      Parameters:
      order - The Order object to be added to the list of orders.

    • cancelOrder

      public void cancelOrder()
      Cancels the currently selected order by removing it from the list of orders. Updates the UI components accordingly. If no orders remain, clears the ListView and total price.

    • refresh

      public void refresh()
      Refreshes the ListView and total price TextField to reflect the currently selected order. Clears the ListView if no order is selected.

    • getPrice

      public double getPrice(ArrayList<MenuItem> items)
      Calculates the total price of the given list of menu items, including tax.
      Parameters:
      items - The list of MenuItem objects for which the total price will be calculated.
      Returns:
      The total price of the items, including tax.

    • setMainController

      public void setMainController(MainController controller, javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage, javafx.scene.Scene primaryScene)
      Sets the reference to the MainController, primary stage, and primary scene. Enables interaction with the MainController's public methods and facilitates scene navigation.
      Parameters:
      controller - The MainController object reference.
      primaryStage - The primary stage of the application.
      primaryScene - The primary scene to return to when navigating back.

    • displayMain

      public void displayMain()
      Navigates back to the main view by setting the primary scene on the primary stage.
